description:
You are given an array of n integers. Your task is to count the number of pairs of indices (i,j) such that ii<j and a[j]−a[i]=j−i.

Input

The first line contains one integer (1 ≤ t ≤ 10^4), the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of two lines:

The first line contains one integer,  (1≤n≤2⋅10^5)
  representing the array.

The sum of n over all test cases does not exceed 2 times 10^5.

Output

For each test case, print a single integer — the number of pairs (i,j) such that i<j and a[j]−a[i]=j−i.
title: Count Pairs with Specific Differences
